review_text: It worked well for us - honestly tho the pictures looked way better than the place does in person. Its pretty small with old carpet but cute. One kid slept on the couch which was not very comfortable, I just stuffed the cracks with a towel to make it flatter and added a comforter below so it wasn't so hard. Had to go hunting for some linens and blankets for the couch but found them. The kitchen was really well stocked and I appreciated the provided coffee and there was extras too that we didn't use. So kind. No problem parking. It's a small apartment that is part of a larger house so a lot of people around but no noise. It was overall a very nice stay.

Jumbo and Mt. Sentinel -- especially pretty at sunset. Jennifer was extremely responsive and helpful. Next time we're in Missoula, we will stay here again!

The property is beautiful - freshly painted, kitchen is stocked to the brim with supplies, the bathroom has everything you could need, and the bedrooms are nicely decorated with very comfortable beds! Highly recommend staying at her properties while in Missoula. Staying here really made our visit perfect.

name: Irene
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Jennifer is rightly a super host. Her place is full of light, super clean, stocked with safe cleaning supplies . The apartment is centrally located but quiet. We were treated cordially by the long term tenants of the building, who jumped to assist us "older folks" with information and kind welcome.
This dwelling has real bathroom supplies, enough kitchen basics to get through supper and breakfast in a last minute stay with high quality, no dollar store stuff here. A strong air purifier runs 24/7. Cable and internet are top notch.
This place embodies everything lovely about the "Missoula vibe."
A special Shout-out to Jennifer: when I expressed concern about their second floor location and how we slightly older folks might be a bit worried: We stayed in for a snow day Tuesday. We ventured out Wednesday with ice trax in hand.....and the steps were clear and dry along with the entire walkway.....and we slept through it all.
This is a wonderful place.

review_text:
My SigO and I visited my mother in Missoula this past week, and stayed at Jennifer’s apartment near downtown. The location was central to every place we wanted to visit: a great grocery store, restaurants, shops (Rockin’ Rudy’s is around the corner), First Friday Art Walk, parks, mom’s house, etc.
The apartment was super cute, cozy and clean. The bathroom and kitchen were well stocked with all of the necessities, including a coffee grinder and French press. I’m sure we used more of the supplied coffee beans than the average guests. Haha.
Jennifer is a gracious host, who went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed.
We will definitely stay here again, if available, on our next visit.

Stayed with kids
review_text: My husband and I road-tripped from Seattle to Missoula with our 3-week old baby for the wedding of our dear friend. Our stay at Jennifer’s place made it all possible. We could venture out on foot to the Hip Strip, River front walks, and beyond. There was plenty of space for the pack-and-play and the full kitchen had everything we needed to cook a few times for ourselves during our four night stay. The bed was very comfortable and the soaps in the bathroom were high quality- that sounds like a funny thing to highlight, but when you don’t get much sleep with a newborn, the morning shower with nice soap makes all the difference… as does the coffee and tea that were stocked in the kitchen. Jennifer has really thought of everything! Thank you!

One block from a neighborhood grocer, and very private. The apartment is adorable, with personal touches and fully stocked kitchen great to cook in. Big comfy chairs for coffee in the morning sun. Comfy bed. Really just a sweet place to stay. Highly recommended!!!

review_text:
This "hip strip" location hosted by Jennifer is the perfect location for a solo traveler or a couple. it is minutes to everywhere - downtown, the river, the eponymous Hip Strip, the campus - but at the seem time it is quiet and makes sleeping and relaxing easy.
The location is very well stocked, especially if you are a coffee enthusiast. I found organic fair trade caffeinated and decaf coffees, multiple sweeteners, and even a choice of a "Mr Coffee" type brewing device and a French press.
the furniture is neo-retro, and is both funky and comfy. I am a picky person when it comes to bedding, and the main bed, its linens, and its pillows all get high marks from me.
P.S. I lovedd the "Missoula Intersections" poster on the living room wall that I found it on Etsy and ordered one for myself and one for my brother.

In my opinion, even if my husband had been there, we would not have felt cramped. We would've had plenty of room to watch tv, to stretch out w our travel yoga mat, make a little dinner. I love that the bathroom is not close to the bed so even though it's small ,one feele like you enjoy privacy in the bathroom. It's a magic space that is quite small but does not feel that way at all. ,

,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Great, cozy place filled with wonderful natural light..... I would stay again. Felt relaxed and safe and sweet after two weeks of wilderness and intense outdoors exertion. As a woman traveling solo, this is just what I needed. To be able to sleep in the fresh and soft linens, take a long shower, and catch up on emails (good wifi) after being out of touch with folks was relaxing and nice. The kitchen had it all and I could cook meals in and not have to go out. The sunlight coming in (I loved that sooo much!), being up in the trees at bird level with lilacs right outside, the little flowers from the garden left in a vase and obviously just picked. Home-made salsa left in the fridge with a bag of chips to go with... (what a sweet surprise!) You can tell she just loves really following through and going the extra mile to REALLY make sure you have everything you need - and more. She is very thorough in her communication and I appreciated that being a detail-oriented person myself. LOVED.

Naomi is a kind and thoughtful host who has her place totally dialed in for visitors like myself. I hope to stay at the studio again on a future visit. Thank you!

The bed is cozy and it's nice that it folds away in a sleeper couch so you can have a little more room during the day. The desk is a great place to focus, and the apartment is a nice walk from the Burns St. Bistro and the downtown area. Naomi is super responsive and sweet. Overall just a wonderful spot, highly recommended.

This Airbnb is an absolute jewel!!! The first thing that I noticed was how sparkling clean the studio was. Everything was shiny, beautiful and the floors literally gleamed. Then it was the little touches, like extra pillows and towels, and I was thrilled with the color therapy dual showerheads.
I really appreciated how responsive Naomi was when I needed something for the kitchen, which was sweet and easy to use. I loved how everything was labeled which really set my mind at ease. It’s obvious that Naomi is conscientious and adheres to all the safety protocols. It was the exact sanctuary that I needed and it was wonderful to have the whole place to myself.
I loved being able to get fresh greens out of the garden for my morning shake. The location was perfect for me. Very central and it’s close to a health-food store and a wonderful river walking path. I would definitely stay here again and would love to come back and stay during each season.

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My recent stay at this apartment in downtown Missoula was fantastic! The check-in process was a breeze thanks to the easy-to-follow instructions provided by the host. The apartment itself may be small, but it's cleverly designed with great amenities that make the most of the space.
The decor was stylish and modern, and the furniture was comfortable and in excellent condition. However, I must mention that while the bed was cozy, it wasn't the most comfortable I've slept on. I would recommend bringing your own pillows if you're particular about them.
One minor issue was that the room could get a bit stuffy due to the radiator, but opening the windows helped to alleviate this. Despite these small quirks, my overall experience was very positive.
The best part of this apartment is its unbeatable location. It's close to numerous shops, restaurants, the hip strip, and the river, making it easy to explore everything that downtown Missoula has to offer. I enjoyed strolling along the riverban

A great spot for a single traveller or a couple, this bright condo has more storage space than you'd first think!
Located halfway between the two fun shopping areas, you're right at the bridge and can walk everywhere in town. The view out one side is the river where you can wander to in less than five mins to catch the surfers and kayakers on the wave. The other views are of the town and city, and there's a nice reading nook in one of the windows.
We visited the one full week of the year that it rained every.day so we were glad to have the included underground parking.
Nicole and Andy are responsive and were quick with answers/suggestions to any of our Qs.
I'd stay here again in future.
Thanks!!

review_text: Wonderful space, we'll book again when in Missoula. Eric was communicative and gave clear instructions for arrival. It's a very comfortable place for resting, for cooking and dining, and especially the bed for sleeping. Wow, we want to get a mattress like that! The location is excellent. The place is as described and well appointed. If you are a walker, the campus and downtown are easily accessible. My wife and I did a 3.8 mile walk through campus (which I attended 45 years ago) then toward downtown for a nice dinner at Ciao Mambo Italian restaurant, ice cream at Sweet Peaks, and finally strolled around downtown before heading back to the house. Missoula is an energetic and exciting town. People were out and about all over town for a Wednesday. We highly recommend the Poplar Retreat for a relaxing and comfortable stay in Missoula.

Good spot for a couple or solo traveler to lay their head while visiting Missoula. Oh and the price was great.
Located in a quiet area, easy to feel safe.

review_text:
Our stay was great! The place was private and easy to find. I was most afraid of finding street parking, but there is a very accessible spot in front of the garage in the alley (they gave us a giant truck at the airport and it still fit just fine). You must use the bathtub. I am in love with that tub.
The bed was very comfy, and there is a lot of closet space. We were here for a wedding, so it was nice to hang things up.
10/10 would stay again!

A cleaning fee of 38 euros is very high in this case because you have to take away your garbage yourself, wash the towels and do the dishes. The accommodation itself was cozy and pleasant. Sorry about the area.

review_text:
The house very nice and the bed was comfortable. Bathroom had a bear claw tub/shower with good water pressure. Perfect size little guest house for 2. Location was the main attraction for us, as we drove to Missoula from Helena to see Nathaniel Rateliff and the Night Sweats at Kettlehouse Amphitheater. It's right off the Interstate and only a mile away from the Top Hat in case you plan to take the shuttle (wish we did that).
I can't say enough about how cute this place was, how quiet the neighborhood was, and there was place plenty of parking. Will go back in the future! 👍👍

NOTE: For the noise sensitive, while the neighborhood is sleepy and quiet, there is a freight train that passes multiple times during the day/night. This train will blow its horn while going over a nearby crossing, so if you are noise sensitive, this may be a problem for you.

review_text:
We loved this little house. Perfect size for my husband and I. We came to Missoula for MaggotFest Rugby Tournament and we were very grateful to have a private quiet place to return to after busy days.
CLEAN, everything was perfectly clean and not a speck of dirt or dust anywhere!
Kitchen had dishes, pots and pans which was a welcome surprise for us. Lots of storage and a very nice bathroom :)
The hottest day was Saturday and Eric went out of his way to put not one but TWO air conditioners in so we were comfortable. We were very grateful.
Only downsides are that the curtains were almost sheer, so the living room felt like everyone could see us... and that the water heater did not last very long.
9.5 out of 10 for us!!!!! We will definitely be renting again next year for MaggotFest if it's available!!! Thank you very much Eric!

Stayed one night
review_text: We stopped at Eric's place for a night just to break up the drive between Yellowstone and Glacier and to just check out Missoula. So this place was perfect for a night. It was small (which we knew) with TV and coffee pot in the bedroom so I don't think most folks will want to spend a lot of time in the apartment. On the flip side, it was a great location. Right off the highway (NO highway noise at all), less than a mile to main street with lots of bars/restaurants and if you want a little exercise, it is two blocks away from the Mt. Jumbo Trailhead which we go up early and hiked. The place was emaculate and the coffee beans and grinder were an awesome touch. There was a little yard (kudo's to Eric on the lawn!!!) with chairs. We sat outside in 72F weather and enjoyed a cocktail and sat in the late September sun. After that, we drove into town, had a nice dinner and the next morning we went for a hike and were on the road by 9am. Short but sweet stay!

review_text:
What a great place to relax. Thayer and Jocelyn were very nice and accommodating. I was only there one night, but they very much made me feel welcome.
On to the important stuff… first of all, the description and pictures are 100% accurate. Next, it is extremely clean and well stocked. They have thought of most everything.
What else is important? The unit is very well laid out. Info on WiFi, heat, etc. is easy to find. The bed was comfortable and I loved the white noise machine. Yes, it is close to the interstate, but I did not find it intrusive.
The convenience store across the street was super handy, too.
Downtown is a quick 5 minute drive and Thayler recommended a great place to eat too.
Overall, this is how you want your AirBnb experience to be.

And there was a hair straightener we could use, which was so fun after a week of camping! We didn't spend too much time at the AirBnB, as we went into town for the evening. But we enjoyed the time there. I could hear some traffic at night as it is close to the freeway, but was still able to sleep fine. It was easy to make coffee in the morning in the small kitchen. It would have been too far to walk downtown, but was just a 5 minute drive away. We enjoyed this place and would definitely stay here again!

review_text:
Thank you Mike for a great experience!
This was my first stay at an AirBnB and if every host is like Mike, then I will be staying at more. The process was very easy and after I booked my room, Mike contacted me immediately and told me that a guest was staying longer and offered another room, with a private bathroom for a little more money. It was a bargain!
The house, my room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. I had my own key for the lock and access to the kitchen, living room, which had an inset fireplace, and laundry if I wanted. I was in Missoula visiting my son so I only saw Mike the first night and the day before I left. Both times, I felt comfortable with him and wished that I had been able to spend more time with him but my son had plans for me! I was able to meet two other guests who were also friendly. The atmosphere at Mike’s felt like a home away from home.
Do NOT hesitate when deciding if you should stay at Mike’s. You SHOULD!

name: Pete
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

March 2024
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: Mike's home is a level above Super Host. I was at Mike's for 5 months as I transitioned to Missoula. Mike is a rare human in that he's sincerely thoughtful about your comfort. His home is extra clean and comfortable and is situated in a quiet neighborhood in the best part of Missoula. His local suggestions from bakeries and restaurants to the nearest biking trails and events are better than a professional guide. You can choose quiet solitude or mingle with Mike and other guests in harmony. Mike was a chef and you'll find all the latest kitchen gear featured on America's Test Kitchen to cook with. Plus, Mike always seems to be making fresh bread so the whole house smells like freshly baked bread and so beautifully done like a photo from a cookbook. There is no better home in Missoula to stay for one night or several months as I did. Mike has all the amenities, modern tasteful furnishings and much more and you'll be more comfortable and cared for than the finest hotels in America.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Goose room was a dream come true after a long, smoky drive from Billings. The king bed was so comfortable with perfect linens and fluffy pillows. The private attached bathroom was a sweet spot to decompress in a hot shower. It was a delight to leave my mess of luggage in the walk-in closet with dresser drawers, where I could shut the door and relax. The desk in the bedroom was charming and utilitarian with a comfortable chair. Fast wi-fi and a window unit for extra A/C comfort. The kitchen was fully stocked and labeled with shareable items. The living room was so comfortable for reading and winding down. The designated parking spot and keypad entry made the whole check-in a breeze. The neighborhood was lovely and close to everything and as a cherry on top, Mike was a fantastic resource on what’s cool as well as a pleasantly social but unobtrusive host. I enjoyed my time here greatly and *will* be a repeat visitor the next time I’m in Missoula! Excellent place to be!

The house was cozy and comfortable, we appreciated the full kitchen, the clean bathrooms, and the spacious common areas with plenty of natural light. We had a great stay and highly recommend Mike’s place!

Amenities such as bathrobes and bath salts, charcuterie boards and cutlery, fluffy comforters and knit booties, made us feel pampered and relaxed. It is quiet as a church. There are lots of windows, but also black shades that can be drawn for near-complete darkness. Best of all, there are actual paintings that are actually good and a lovely, eclectic pottery selection that honors Missoula's ceramic heritage -- try finding that in a hotel.

Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Ann's room with bathroom was fully stocked (really too stocked) with items you might need/want during your stay. The bed was comfy and the location close enough to walk to all things Hip-Strip and the UofM. Perfect place for a night or two. The bedroom has some really cool items but there is so...much...stuff (books, chachkies, linens) that it makes it hard to keep track of your own things and find places to put them. The bathroom is very dark. There's only one bulb above the mirror which makes it challenging to put on make-up or take a shower after dark. The room is located on the first floor. If there are guests upstairs, you will hear them. There is a designated parking pad close to the door which is great. Maneuvering out of the neighborhood is a bit tricky due to Front Street being a one way street. You have to cheat the wrong way (just a hair) if you want to go downtown. Not a deal breaker but a need to know. I met Ann real quick and she was helpful and Missoula cool!

We appreciated the coffee station and mini fridge plus the extra touches like flowers and robes. Her local recommendation sheets were packed with useful info (and funny commentary) for nearby restaurants and activities, including an awesome brewery/taco spot and a delicious bakery. Comfy bed, too. Wish we'd had more time to explore the neighborhood (many walkable things nearby!) but we were just stopping for one night on a longer road trip. Hope to visit again!

Oh, and we walked everywhere from/to this darling home base; to the river, to campus, to get pizza...! Looking forward to spending more time in Missoula come next adventure, hopefully our dates will align with this delightful b n' b again. Thanks Ann!

name: Clara

Rating, 4 stars
,
·
February 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
We booked this AirBnb as 2 Missoula locals wanting a night out, not in our own home! It was a lovely apartment space with tasteful decor, good heating and cooling and a stellar location in Missoula.
I will admit, we arrived fully expecting a kitchen space to cook dinner and breakfast the next day, so we were a little disappointed (mostly in our selves for not catching that when we booked the place) that there was no kitchen, but Anne provides amenities like a water heater, coffee maker, water pitchers, mini fridge and microwave, so everything ended up working out just fine.
It was a pleasure to stay in the Iconic green building that is such a staple to the entrance of Missoula, and I would absolutely do it again!

name: Lanie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I loved the decor of the room, the use of antique furniture, the carpets that covered the concrete floor etc. The bed was compfy which is key to a good night's stay! Our pet was allowed and we know where to take her around town to run and play etc. this might have been tricky for others without that information. The BEST amenity was a little fridge with 1/2 & 1/2 in it! This made my day. Because we had to get up and out so early we actually didn't take advantage of this wonderful amenity but for those of us who put cream in our coffee this is a deal maker!
In addition, I left a pair of earrings there and she responded right away and provided me with an opportunity to retrieve them easily. I would rent here again in a minute.
